space.arim.api.concurrent

Interface Scheduler

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AsyncExecution, SyncExecution
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultAsyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution, DefaultSyncExecution

    public interface Scheduler
    A scheduler designed for creating delayed and timed tasks.
    Specifications:
    * Requires runTaskLater(Runnable, long)
    * Requires runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long, long)
    * Default implementations: See below

    Contract:
    * Each method returns a Task representing the scheduled task. Such returned Task objects' Task.cancel() method should succeed in ceasing further scheduling of the task.
    * All time units are in milliseconds to provide compatibility with implementing platforms which do not support other units.

    Default implementations:
    * runTaskTimer(Runnable, long) calls runTaskTimerLater(java.lang.Runnable, long, long) with delay parameter as 0. This may be overriden if doing so increases efficiency.
    * All methods accept either a basic Runnable or a Consumer as the task to schedule. Callers may use the method accepting a consumer parameter so that the executing task can cancel its own scheduling. Default implementations need never be overriden. They derive from the corresponding methods accepting Runnable parameters.
    Author:
    A248

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Task runTaskLater(Consumer<Task> command, long delay)
      Same as runTaskLater(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
      Task runTaskLater(Runnable command, long delay)
      Runs a delayed task
      default Task runTaskTimer(Consumer<Task> command, long period)
      Same as runTaskTimer(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
      default Task runTaskTimer(Runnable command, long period)
      Runs a timed repeating task.
      default Task runTaskTimerLater(Consumer<Task> command, long delay, long period)
      Same as #runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
      Task runTaskTimerLater(Runnable command, long delay, long period)
      Runs a timed repeating task with an additional initial delay.

    • Method Detail

      • runTaskLater

        Task runTaskLater(Runnable command,
                  long delay)
        Runs a delayed task
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        delay - the delay
        Returns:
        a cancellable task

      • runTaskLater

        default Task runTaskLater(Consumer<Task> command,
                          long delay)
        Same as runTaskLater(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        delay - the delay
        Returns:
        a cancellable task

      • runTaskTimer

        default Task runTaskTimer(Runnable command,
                          long period)
        Runs a timed repeating task. The task may be cancelled.

        Default implementation: returns runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long, long) with the delay parameter (2nd param) set to zero.
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        period - the timespan between executions
        Returns:
        a cancellable task

      • runTaskTimer

        default Task runTaskTimer(Consumer<Task> command,
                          long period)
        Same as runTaskTimer(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        period - the timespan between executions
        Returns:
        a cancellable task

      • runTaskTimerLater

        Task runTaskTimerLater(Runnable command,
                       long delay,
                       long period)
        Runs a timed repeating task with an additional initial delay. The task may be cancelled to stop further scheduling.
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        period - the timespan between executions
        delay - the initial delay
        Returns:
        a cancellable task

      • runTaskTimerLater

        default Task runTaskTimerLater(Consumer<Task> command,
                               long delay,
                               long period)
        Same as #runTaskTimerLater(Runnable, long) but with the ability to access the task (and thus cancel further scheduling of it) from within the execution itself.
        Parameters:
        command - the execution
        period - the timespan between executions
        delay - the initial delay
        Returns:
        a cancellable task
